revised_title: Observations on the Functions of the Intestinal Canal and Liver in the Human Foetus
tldr: The author, Robert Lee, observed the functions of the intestinal canal and liver in human foetuses. He found that the contents of the alimentary canal in foetuses were similar in appearance and chemical composition to those in adults. Lee concluded that the liver supplies materials for nutrition in the foetus, and that these substances are not derived from the mouth. This research also applies to acephalous children and cases where the oesophagus is impervious.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Anatomy and Physiology
